title: Marc Chagall America Windows Silk Scarf
description:
Scarf developed from Marc Chagall’s America Windows, 1977, from the collection of the Art Institute of Chicago.

America Windows presents an unusual secular theme in Chagall's oeuvre, merging symbols of American history, the Chicago skyline, and the arts; reading from left to right, the panels represent music, painting, literature, architecture, theater, and dance.  This silk scarf incorporates elements from all six panels.

  • Dimensions: 36 x 36 in.
  • Material: Silk.
  • Dry clean only.

*This item cannot be shipped to a destination outside the United States.
